results.title: Hong Kong: wandering with Rick
results.brief_description: With Rick we take a ferry-boat across Repulse Bay and catch a cable car up Victoria Peak for a panoramic view of Hong Kong. We ride a sampan from a fishing village, visit the busy docks of Hong Kong harbour and enjoy a rick-shaw ride through crowqded city streets.

results.title: Hong Kong
results.brief_description: This is a British account of one of its colonies for over one hundred years. It describes the positive influences from Britain on the economy but also documents influences from China due to the large Chinese population, on culture and family. Also recognises China’s desire to regain Hong Kong.

results.title: Homage a George Bizet
results.brief_description: Biographical account of Georges Bizet’s life supported by and illustrated with excerpts from his compositions. Particularly featured are L’Arlierienne and Carmen. In French language only.

results.title: Hitch hiker
results.creator_credit: Gerald Varney, Polly Turner and CPC Productions
results.brief_description: Young hitchhikers are interviewed and we hear their philosophy regarding hitchhiking. We hear their poetry, see them camping amid spectacular scenery and meet the people who are willing to pick them up. This activity is seen as a rebellion to parental authority and a statement of individualism.

results.title: Historical marine paintings by Richard Linton
results.brief_description: Richard Linton was born in Melbourne in 1935. He began working in photolithography after studying at the Australian School of Printing. His first serious painting of a sailing ship was in 1957. His love of history and meticulous attention to detail make him a world authority on the subject and unique in today’s art world. With his knowledge of printing he also produces limited edition prints of his works. In this video, Richard Linton explains his working process, including researching and painting, and talks about his paintings of Australian and overseas built sailing ships.

results.title: His Majesty
results.brief_description: Animated film about a king losing his temper. Suddenly we see that the king is only a chess piece on a board and he becomes meek.

results.title: Hillary ventures south
results.brief_description: A documentary chronicling a visit to Tasmania by Sir Edmund Hillary. He arrives, meets some dignitaries, surveys some national park areas to the south of Hobart, then joins a bushwalking club to scale Mount Mawson. The film focusses on what a thrill it is for these youngsters to climb alonside the man who scaled Everest. Hillary, the narrator tells us, says Tasmania has some of the greatest tramping country in the world.

results.title: High Ground
results.brief_description: An historical overview of building development in the City of Melbourne culminating in the building of 101 Collins Street. Some fascinating archival footage is used to illustrate how the top end of Collins Street and the city in general developed as “the high ground”.

results.title: Herman's secrets of sales success
results.creator_credit: Robert W Swanson and Rudy Swanson Productions
results.brief_description: A parody of Mercantile instructional films, cheerfully ridiculous in its inversion of sales-pitch conventions. Original music by John McCarthy and virtuoso percussionist, David Carroll.
